actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to increase from $240 to $480 per year the amount of earned income which will be excluded in determining eligibility for and amount of benefits payable to individuals under the Federal program for supplemental security income for the aged, blind, and disabled, established by title XVI of the Social Security Act.

summary.text: Increases from $240 to $480 per year the amount of earned income which will be excluded in determining eligibility for and amount of benefits payable to individuals under the Federal program for supplemental security income for the aged, blind, and disabled, established by title XVI (Supplemental Security Income for the Aged Blind and Disabled Program) of the Social Security Act. (Amends 42 U.S.C. 403)

titles.title: A bill to increase from $240 to $480 per year the amount of earned income which will be excluded in determining eligibility for and amount of benefits payable to individuals under the Federal program for supplemental security income for the aged, blind, and disabled, established by title XVI of the Social Security Act.
